curam.util.administration.impl

Class SecurityAdmin

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.administration.base.SecurityAdmin
      • curam.util.administration.impl.SecurityAdmin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SecurityAdmin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SecurityAdminFactory

    public abstract class SecurityAdmin
extends curam.util.administration.base.SecurityAdmin
    SecurityAdmin is the administration interface for Curam Security. It provides methods for changing, deleting, inserting and reading Security roles, groups and identifiers.

    A User is assigned a Security Role.
    A Security Role maps to a list of Security Groups.
    A Security Group maps to a list of Security Identifiers.
    A Security Identifier may optionally map to a list of Function Identifiers.

    Role -> Group -> Security Identifier [ -> Function Identifier ]

      • listAllMatchSecurityIdentifiers

        public SecurityIdentifierDetailsList listAllMatchSecurityIdentifiers(java.lang.String searchString)
                                                              throws AppException,
                                                                     DatabaseException,
                                                                     InformationalException
        Return the list of all the security identifiers that matches with the specified search string. The search is case sensitive and the search string could be a exact, partial or region match of security identifier name.
        Parameters:
        searchString - The search string could be the exact, partial or region match of security identifier name.
        Returns:
        The full list of security identifiers that matches the specified search string. The list is null if no match security identifiers found for the specified search string.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • createSecurityRole

        public java.lang.String createSecurityRole(java.lang.String roleName)
                                    throws AppException,
                                           DatabaseException,
                                           InformationalException
        Create a security role and return the new security role ID.
        Parameters:
        roleName - The name of a new security role.
        Returns:
        The ID of the new security role.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_SECURITYADMIN_ROLENAME_EMPTY - if the role name is empty.
        AppException - ID_ROLE_NAME_DUPREC - if the role name already exists.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • deleteSecurityRole

        public void deleteSecurityRole(java.lang.String roleID)
                        throws AppException,
                               DatabaseException,
                               InformationalException
        Remove the specified security role. Any associations between this role and a security group will also be removed. The role cannot be removed if it is in use on the Users database table. No error occurs if the security role does not exist to be removed, as this is the intended action.
        Parameters:
        roleID - The ID of the security role.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_SECURITY_ROLE_IN_USE - if the role is in use by a user.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • readSecurityIdentifier

        public SecurityIdentifierWithFIDDetails readSecurityIdentifier(java.lang.String securityIdentifierID)
                                                        throws AppException,
                                                               DatabaseException,
                                                               InformationalException
        Return the details of the specified security identifier. This includes the associated function identifier, if the security identifier is of type FUNCTION.
        Parameters:
        securityIdentifierID - The ID of the security identifier.
        Returns:
        The details of the security identifier, including the name, description and type of security identifier.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_SID_NOT_FOUND - if the security identifier could not be found.
        AppException - ID_ASSOC_FID_NOT_FOUND - if the associated function identifier could not be found.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

                                java.lang.String groupID)
                         throws AppException,
                                DatabaseException,
                                InformationalException
        Remove the specified security group from the security role. No error occurs if the security group is not associated with the security role, as this is the intended action.
        Parameters:
        roleID - The ID of the security role.
        groupID - The ID of the security group.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • addGroupToRole

        public void addGroupToRole(java.lang.String roleID,
                           java.lang.String groupID)
                    throws AppException,
                           DatabaseException,
                           InformationalException
        Add the security group to the specified security role. No error occurs if the security group already exists in the security role, as this is the intended action.
        Parameters:
        roleID - The ID of the security role.
        groupID - The ID of the security group.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_NO_GROUP_NAME - if the security group does not exist.
        AppException - ID_NO_ROLE_NAME - if the security role does not exist.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • addGroupsToRole

        public void addGroupsToRole(java.lang.String roleID,
                            java.lang.String groupIDList)
                     throws AppException,
                            DatabaseException,
                            InformationalException
        Add the specified list of security groups to the security role. No error occurs if one of the security groups already exists in the security role, as this is the intended action. This also applies for duplicate security groups in the list.
        Parameters:
        roleID - The ID of the security role.
        groupIDList - The tab delimited list of security groups.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_NO_GROUP_NAME - if the security group does not exist.
        AppException - ID_NO_ROLE_NAME - if the security role does not exist.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
        See Also:
        SecurityAdmin.addGroupToRole(String, String)

      • createSecurityGroup

        public java.lang.String createSecurityGroup(NewSecurityGroupDetails newSecurityGroupDetails)
                                     throws AppException,
                                            DatabaseException,
                                            InformationalException
        Create a security group and return the new security group ID. The versionNo field in the newSecurityGroupDetails parameter is ignored by this method.
        Parameters:
        newSecurityGroupDetails - The details of the security group to add. (The versionNo field is ignored.)
        Returns:
        The new security group ID.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_SECURITYADMIN_GROUPNAME_EMPTY - if the security group name is empty.
        AppException - ID_GROUP_EXISTS - if the security group name already exists.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • addSIDsToGroup

        public void addSIDsToGroup(java.lang.String securityIdentifierIDList,
                           java.lang.String groupID)
                    throws AppException,
                           DatabaseException,
                           InformationalException
        Add the specified list of security identifiers to the security group. No error occurs if one of the security identifiers already exists in the security group, as this is the intended action. This also applies for duplicate security identifiers in the list.
        Parameters:
        securityIdentifierIDList - A tab delimited list of security identifiers.
        groupID - The ID of the security group.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_NO_GROUP_NAME - if the security group does not exist.
        AppException - ID_SID_NOT_FOUND - if the security identifier does not exist.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
        See Also:
        SecurityAdmin.addSIDToGroup(String, String)

      • createFunctionSID

        public java.lang.String createFunctionSID(java.lang.String functionID,
                                          SecurityIdentifierNameDescription details)
                                   throws AppException,
                                          DatabaseException,
                                          InformationalException
        Create a new security identifier of type 'FUNCTION' with a related function identifier. The versionNo field in the details parameter is ignored by this method.
        Parameters:
        details - The details of the new security identifier. (The versionNo field is ignored.)
        functionID - The ID of the function identifier to associate with the security identifier.
        Returns:
        The ID of the newly created security identifier.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_SID_NOT_FOUND - if the security identifier does not exist.
        AppException - ID_SECURITYADMIN_SIDNAME_EMPTY - if the security identifier name is empty.
        AppException - ID_FID_NOT_FOUND - if the specified function identifier does not exist.
        AppException - ID_SID_ALREADY_LINKED - if the security identifier is already linked to another function identifier.
        AppException - ID_FID_ALREADY_LINKED - if the function identifier is already linked to another security identifier.
        AppException - ID_ADD_SID_DUPREC - if the security identifier already exists on the database.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • listAvailableFIDs

        public FunctionIdentifierDetailsList listAvailableFIDs()
                                                throws AppException,
                                                       DatabaseException,
                                                       InformationalException
        Return the list of function identifiers not assigned to any security identifier.
        Returns:
        A list of function identifier details.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • deleteSecurityIdentifier

        public void deleteSecurityIdentifier(java.lang.String securityIdentifierID)
                              throws AppException,
                                     DatabaseException,
                                     InformationalException
        Remove the specified security identifier. Any associations between security groups and the security identifier are also removed. No error occurs if the security identifier does not exist to be removed as this is the intended action.
        Parameters:
        securityIdentifierID - The ID of a security identifier.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • createSecurityIdentifier

        public java.lang.String createSecurityIdentifier(NewSecurityIdentifierDetails details)
                                          throws AppException,
                                                 DatabaseException,
                                                 InformationalException
        Create a security identifier and return the new security identifier ID. The security identifier type can be anything except FUNCTION. Examples include PRODUCT and LOCATION. To add a security identifier of type FUNCTION the createFunctionSID() method should be used.
        Parameters:
        details - The details of the security identifier.
        Returns:
        The ID of the newly created security identifier.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_FIDNAME_EMPTY - if the type of the security identifier specified is FUNCTION.
        AppException - ID_SECURITYADMIN_SIDNAME_EMPTY - if the security identifier name is blank.
        AppException - ID_ADD_SID_DUPREC - if the security identifier name is already in use.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
        See Also:
        SecurityAdmin.createFunctionSID(String, SecurityIdentifierNameDescription)

      • modifySecurityIdentifier

        public void modifySecurityIdentifier(java.lang.String securityIdentifierID,
                                     SecurityIdentifierNameDescription details)
                              throws AppException,
                                     DatabaseException,
                                     InformationalException
        Modify the name and description of the specified security identifier.
        Parameters:
        securityIdentifierID - The ID of the security identifier to modify.
        details - The new security identifier details.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_SECURITYADMIN_SIDNAME_EMPTY - if the security identifier name is empty.
        AppException - ID_ADD_SID_DUPREC - if the security identifier name is already in use.
        AppException - ID_SID_NOT_FOUND - if the security identifier does not exist.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • modifyFunctionSID

        public void modifyFunctionSID(java.lang.String securityIdentifierID,
                              SecurityIdentifierNameDescription details,
                              java.lang.String newFunctionIdentifier)
                       throws AppException,
                              DatabaseException,
                              InformationalException
        Modify the name, description and associated function identifier of the specified security identifier.
        Parameters:
        securityIdentifierID - The ID of the security identifier to modify.
        details - The new security identifier details.
        newFunctionIdentifier - The new associated function identifier.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_SECURITYADMIN_SIDNAME_EMPTY - if the security identifier name is empty.
        AppException - ID_ADD_SID_DUPREC - if the security identifier name is already in use.
        AppException - ID_SID_NOT_FOUND - if the security identifier does not exist.
        AppException - ID_NOT_FUNCTION_SID - if the security identifier is not of type FUNCTION.
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
